comment:
Very personable, respectful guy. He cares for your success. Go to class, complete the assignments and you should have no problem doing well on exams. The first test was difficult to me, and I think everyone; as a result, he made the next two test significantly easier. 
Overall great guy and professor. Also a PE so he knows the industry well.

He is a great professor who is clear about how he's going to teach and what he is going to test you on. You should put in the effort after class to study because the subject is hard despite the great lectures.

I had him for EE 3401 but it's not an option on this page. He is very caring and loves his students. He is a good grader and is very fair. It is a difficult course, but he makes this heavy class a little lighter with his humor and his joyful teaching. Tips*** Study the slides and optional textbook. And touch up on your circuit analysis.

Professor Kazemian is one of the best professors I have taken. He does this part-time out of a love for students and teaching. The class material is by no means easy, but Kazemian does a great job explaining tough subjects. This is a professor who genuinely cares about your learning. I wish I was an EE major so I could take more classes with him.
He was really friendly, and helped greatly throughout the semester. Easy to score an A, very understanding and you learn a lot out from his class.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: He is a great professor. He takes time to explain the topic and makes sure the students understand it before he moves on. He is also very accessible outside of class. He grades fairly and gives partial credit unlike some other teachers. Would definitely recommend

Andrew is one of the best professors in the Electrical Engineering department hands down. He cares about the students and answered any questions I had anytime I saw in him person or through email. I highly recommend his classes.

Whoever it was below that said Professor Kazemian is rude are out of their mind. He is one of the most caring and thoughtful professors I have ever had. He gives his time to every student and makes sure you get answers to your questions and is super relatable to his students.

I had professor Kazemian in a previous class and wasnt fond of him but took him again. His ego is large and doesn't respect students or their time. As much help as he was, its very hard to deal with him on a personal level. my advice, don't ask many questions or get too involved with him because he will take it as you owe him something in return.
Highly recommend him for any class he teaches. 10/10 professor

Professor Kazemian was alright. I definitely struggled with his grading of the exams because it didn't seem consistent. I'd have to email trying to determine where points were taken off. He did allow us to take the exams from home, which was great. Also, he was pretty nice when responding to emails/asking questions.

Amazing Professor. Very understanding and caring for all of his students. Listen during his lectures and talk to him outside of class for things you do not understand he will give you his time. Even during covid-19, he was one of the best professors I have ever had.

I am not sure what these other students are talking about but, Professor Kazemian is amazing in the class and outside the class. He always gave his time if you asked him. As long as you read the labs you could get through them. A lot of the students think you can just do the lab without reading. For sure sign up for his class if you want to learn.

He would grade the exams completely unfair. If you didn't follow his exact way of doing the problem (you referenced the textbook or other sources) he would take off points even if you got the right answer. Also, the labs were terrible. He would sometimes chastise you for asking questions even though he always said "don't be afraid to ask questions"

Professor Kazemian was great this semester. He worked with usb lot to make things easier than what is typical this semester due to COVID-19 rules. The material is difficult and even though he is a great professor you will have to put the time into the class in order to understand the material and get the grade you want.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Kazemian is all around a wonderful professor. If you put in the work he will work with you to help you be successful. He is passionate about what he teaches and easy to relate to because he is young and not super far removed from real world application of what we are learning.

If this is the only electrical class you need and want an A, take him. If you want actually learn something, take someone else. Says there are no stupid questions but makes you feel awful for asking. Doesn't explain how to do the labs. Begs for you to do his survey so he can get professor of the year. Only interested in making himself look good.

Professor Kazemian is a solid professor the course material isn't too hard as long as you show up to class and do your hw. He's flexible and always willing to answer questions. The labs however, were hard to follow at times and more of a headache then helpful, but he does try to help all as much as he can. I would definitely recommend him.

Prof Andrew was one of the best professors I've had, college or otherwise. You might be put off by how young he is, but he knows his stuff, and he knows how to teach it. He doesn't just read off powerpoints, and he explains each topic clearly. If you're taking circuits analysis 1, I wholeheartedly recommend Prof Andrew!

He is a professor who clearly has a lot of experience and is very knowledgeable. His lectures are as expected. but he does really well in the lab. He is always available for questions and does not hesitate to assist you when you are confused.
His breakdowns are the best. The course is made in a way that it allows you to navigate without difficulty
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Kazemian is great at simplifying/explaining key topics. He is there to help so do not be afraid to ask him anything because he will have an answer for it. Just like any other class, you need to put in the work in his class because it can get difficult no matter how well he explains the topics. If there is a spot open, do not hesitate to take him.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: A miracle professor whose class I was able to join even with limitations regarding class size. He is willing to work with students if they do not understand anything pertaining the course. His tests are a reflection of the lectures. The homework prepares you to be successful. He is committed to be the best professor in the electrical department...

He's a great Professor and one of the things that i liked most about him is that you can ask him any question outside of class on his social media without having to write the emails. If you attend lecture, put effort into doing homework yourself then you can definitely make an A in this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: As long as you do the HW and pay attention in class, an A is possible in this class. Make sure to study on your own time. He tends to read off the slides but overall he is a good professor, willing to work with you.
No surprises, teaches what you'll need to pass tests.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Kazemian is a very good professor. It is possible to get an A in his class: just do your HW, pay attention in class, and do examples on your own. Studying on your own time is crucial to do well. My only complaint is the lack of accessibility out of class and he missed a few classes which put us a little behind, but overall a great choice
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Good professor, works with everyone to get them where they need to be. Have a good attendance, do the homework and group assignments, you will pass. You can not fail his class, if you put in a really good effort you will make an A.

Andrew is a very good person. He's young, and went from student to professor without field exp. in between. Reads off the slides more than I'd like, so youll need to teach yourself most of the course. In all fairness, this seems to be par for KSU these days. He does what's right when it counts and wants you to learn. For his 2301, effort+skillA.

Professor Kazemian is a really fair professor. Hes one of the best professors Ive had here. If you need help, ask and hell help you with no hesitation. Although I bombed his second test, seeking a little bit of help from him during lab helped a lot for my third and fourth test. If you pay attention in his class, you will do exceedingly well.

He is a young professor and very knowledgeable about circuits and electrical engineering. Not very easy, but study well and learn from mistakes. Lab is in a desperate need for an assistant to help with timing and equipment.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Respected

comment: he's the GOAT

Professor Kazemian is perhaps the best university professor I may have encountered until now. I have nothing but praise for him, he is a young guy who is not much older than most students and he really does care for all students in his class. Go to class, participate, study his lectures and examples and you should not struggle at all for his tests.
Love this dude!

He is young himself so he knows how students think and easy ways for them to learn. He is very easy to talk to, very knowledgeable and understanding. Unlike professors with PhD's and such, he is not riding a "high horse" as much as others even though he is of good status. Every professor should be like him and his brother. Genuine and caring.
Very passionate about his work. He is not much older than most students and offers valuable insight to University life as well as the working life in the EE field.

Professor Kazemian is young yet very very knowledgeable in the subject. He uploads everything online but his lectures are golden. Study the examples you go over in class and do the hw and you should well on tests. He makes you work for it, but if you do, you're guaranteed to learn a lot. He genuinely cares for his students. Would def take again!
Overall would take him again. Great lectures and very detailed.
